result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zavian Jerome Riley

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zavian Jerome Riley in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Zavian Jerome Riley.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court on behalf of Abby Rockendorf for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State, but needs additional time to review with client. Court grants request. Case adjourned for a status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services 10-10-2022 Supervision Report

Defendant Zavian Jerome Riley appeared by video, in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Zavian Jerome Riley.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Hall who is newly appointed is not available for the next date of 8/19/2022. This matter has been rescheduled to 8/25/2022 at 1:30pm. Parties are notified.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zavian Jerome Riley in court by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-30-22
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Zavian Jerome Riley in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Zavian Jerome Riley in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
